column5: The skys were cloudy,and rain was in the forcast,but the kids didnt care. What a great turn out.The shore line was packed from the tip of the marina breakwall,all the way to the Heritage park shore line.        Lilly had a blast.She was happy to watch her daddy fish and catch.She was even wearing her lucky fishing hat.      I havent fished the shore line in a longtime,and was very shocked to se the amount of gobies that were being caught.And the size of them.      Some parents knew that they had to be destroyed,others questioned why. After explaining to them the reason,they were just dropping them in the cracks of the boulders.I told them the local minks will be happy to dispose of them.  Was hoping to meet up with Blair and his family,but they were behind.They will be stopping by later today.
There's a reason why the smallmouth bass grow to giant proportions in that lake, I think you've figured it out
Ya I know Bill,but for a kids fishing day,they wanted a more,prettier fish,perch.LOL
True, gobies are ugly little buggers.
I agree Brian the Bay is in a mess with gobbies , its the reason we wont fish the bay any more .
I was going to bring my daughter but she was feeling sick yesterday...trip to the doctor this morning and she's on antibiotics with strep throat.  Glad to see it was a success!  Great pics!
Thanks for sharing Brian, Kudos to the organizers.   Nice to see the kids out having fun. Was it like a little derby Brian?
No Dave. It was just a kids day fishing. Getting kids into fishing.
Looks like an awesome day B  glad you got out with the kids and had fun.

You have a very cute granddaughter. I love to see people fishing with children. I read somewhere that a series of libraries exist where kids can sign out a rod and reel to start their fishing adventures, which I think is an absolutely great idea.

We made it down to the waterfront just before noon. Had our gear but didn't fish. Boys saw the inflatables and b-lined for them. Met a buddy from university and had a short visit. My family had a great time and we loved the waterfront. We met up with Brian, his better half, and Gizmo for a few minutes then went to drop my oldest off at my wife's cousin's place as he will stay in Barrie for the next week as he attends the Mariposa training centre for figure skating. Nice to meet you Brian I hope you can use the floats. Thanks to Betty Ann for the cookies.
LOL EDIT.  Nice to meet ya .
What a crowd! a lot of fun for the kids for sure. The bass are going to be huge eating that gobie diet!!!And the pike!
